content.prompt: Which of the following best describes why the authors claim that reducing noise exposure is currently more of a public policy problem than a scientific problem?

choices.label: There is sufficient scientific evidence that noise exposure can induce hypertension and heart disease.
The relationship of noise with annoyance that negatively impacts human health is a subject for future research.
Most public health impacts of noise were already identified in the 1960s.
It is unclear whether negative cognitive effects are reversible in humans.

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Describe the author's reasoning (use of evidence to support a claim).
